title: Illinois’ HBT makes a $170.2M deal to stretch footprint to St. Louis
summary: Purchasing Carlinville, Illinois-based CNB Bank Shares would add $1.8 billion in assets, $1.5 billion in deposits and $1.3 billion in loans to HBT’s balance sheet, along with 18 locations.

title: Coinbase buys angel investment platform Echo for $375M
summary: Coinbase, much like its competitors, has made a number of acquisitions this year as the crypto market trends upward and federal regulators adopt crypto-friendly policies.

title: Waller floats ‘skinny’ Fed account
summary: Federal Reserve Gov. Christopher Waller proposed the central bank’s staff explore creating a new limited payments account that might be suited to fintechs.

title: OCC’s Gould details regulatory ‘reset’
summary: At the ABA’s annual convention Monday, the comptroller, more than once, referred to the OCC’s actions during his tenure as “down payments,” and promised more community bank “relief” to come.

title: The Office of the Comptroller of the Currency
Texas deal would create $3.1B bank
summary: The deal puts Cornerstone within Texas’ top 20 by deposit market share among the state’s sub-$10 billion-asset banks and is one of several deals focused on the Lone Star State this year.

title: Dive Deposits: Ripple’s 2nd billion-dollar deal of 2025 puts it in elite company
summary: The question is whether the watershed year will give the crypto firm a Morgan Stanley-esque afterglow or one more akin to NYCB.

title: JPMorgan Chase enlists generative AI to drive modernization
summary: While initially skeptical of the technology, the bank deployed guardrails and governance to allay accuracy concerns.

title: Fed, FDIC, OCC withdraw guidance on climate risk management
summary: The regulators have rescinded guidance intended to help financial institutions with over $100 billion in total assets identify and manage financial risks related to climate change.

title: Stablecoin risks abound: Fed’s Barr
summary: To make stablecoins viable, regulators implementing the Genius Act must impose protective guardrails, Federal Reserve Gov. Michael Barr told a fintech conference.

title: Fifth Third, Truist flag nonbank lending
summary: As Zions, Western Alliance and other banks revealed exposures to nonbank lenders, one analyst noted that concern around that sector is the “topic du jour.”

title: CFPB ends Citi consent order 3 years early
summary: The bank allegedly discriminated against Armenian-Americans in California, according to the 2023 consent order.

title: Dive Deposits: Vought sees CFPB shuttered in ‘2-3 months’
summary: The CFPB’s acting director floated the timeline in a podcast appearance Wednesday, after weeks of relative silence on the bureau’s status.

title: Banks chase AI-fueled efficiencies
summary: While Citi and Goldman are working to infuse AI into workflow, a Wells Fargo exec said the bank's "efficiency agenda" still needs a tune-up.

title: First Citizens to acquire 138 BMO branches
summary: Buying the branches, which span 11 states, furthers First Citizens’ effort to expand nationally, bank executives said. One analyst, though, said it gives the North Carolina-based lender “a weird map.”

title: Bank of America, BNY sued by alleged Epstein victim
summary: In a complaint, Jane Doe recalls opening an account at BofA at the direction of the late financier’s then-accountant. Doe alleged she received rent money and other funds through the account.

title: Citi rolls out AI prompt training requirement to most staff
summary: While a growing share of employers have rolled out artificial intelligence at work, comparatively few offer training at the contributor level, according to a recent survey.

title: Kraken buys derivatives platform for $100M
summary: CFTC-regulated Small Exchange is Kraken’s fourth acquisition this year, as a “clear and positive regulatory environment in the U.S. gives companies the confidence to invest and grow with more certainty,” one executive said.

title: First Horizon keeps options open amid M&A uptick
summary: The Memphis, Tennessee-based bank’s CEO is “increasingly confident in our ability to integrate a well-structured merger,” but also indicated the lender is focused on “optionality,” he said Wednesday.

title: Tech-focused Erebor Bank gets conditional OCC approval
summary: The bank, backed by billionaire investor Peter Thiel and founded by two tech pioneers, will serve companies focused on crypto, AI, defense and manufacturing.
